Original question: For a system composed of a small mass of gas passing through a rocket nozzle, describe the physical implications of an adiabatic, quasi-equilibrium (i.e. quasi- static) process.
Solution: Such an assumption would imply that the mass of gas passes through the nozzle too fast for significant heat transfer to occur, but at a rate which is slow compared to the time it takes the small mass of gas to come to thermodynamic equilibrium.
